result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan R Brown

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:30 AM Defendant Ryan R Brown in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Ryan R Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:03 PM Defendant Ryan R Brown in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff appeared by zoom video.  Court reviews the history of the case on the record noting Attorney Peter Wolff was just appointed yesterday.  The Court finds this hearing should have been removed once the order appointing counsel came in.  Next date remains as previously set.
Public Defender Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Jeremy Perri.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:54 PM Defendant Ryan R Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Ryan R Brown. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto.Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on August 24, 2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan R Brown
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-24-2022)
Prior: 3316 S 8th St, Milwaukee, WI 53215

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to have no contact with victims A-D (unless they initiate contact or in an emergency fashion) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:03 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Ryan R Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Ryan R Brown. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
